All babies look alike when they have their clothes on, but each of them is something quite unique.
How?

You and Little G did not look at all like one another. You cried all the time when you were a baby, whereas Little G was quiet as a mouse. She could walk before you, but you could talk before her. The children listen. Charlotte looks at GEORGIANA.
What about me, Mama?

You never cried, darling. You were always so brave. They have reached the cascade by the side of the house. T children instinctively run in and start playing in the wa GEORGIANA turns to look down the hill. She should be happ She isn't. Then she seems to see someone. HER POV -- A MA coming across the GREEN. As he gets closer she realises w it is: GREY.
GEORGIANA waits for GREY. He takes off his hat and bows. It’s awkward, stiff.
Your Grace.
(nods ) Mister Grey. Are you recalled from France?
For a while.
No revolution yet?
No, not yet. But it’s only a matter of time. They look at each other. A long beat, then:
I bore a son. GREY realizes she is making a point.
Yes...
His name is William George Spencer Cavendish, Marquis of Hartington. We shall call him Hart.
You and the Duke must be very pleased.
We are. He has gone to London to celebrate. Beat. GREY gazes at her. They're both full of longing.
You have been missed...much missed...How is it that you are here?
I received an invitation. I assumed it was on behalf of the party; I could not say no. GEORGIANA is confused, but covers it up.
Yes, of course. Come inside.  111 112 113 114

CLOSE UP of fingers playing strings on a harp. The camera tracks back to reveal a HARPIST next to a STRING QUARTET. The music carries through this scene and the next... The GUESTS play cards. GEORGIANA and SHERIDAN are on one table, BESS, GREY and FOX on the other. The atmosphere is tense. GEORGIANA can’t help glancing from her table to GREY at his. GREY can’t help glancing back.
Down six hundred. G. Yours?
(distracted) Yes, of course. I will match you.
You'll need cards, of course. GEORGIANA realizes SHERIDAN hasn't dealt yet.

I am too tired to play. (Nodding to the players) Gentlemen. GEORGIANA gets up and leaves the room. Just outside BESS comes up to her. There is silence and suspicion from GEORGIANA. She tries to continue walking.
No one must know. GEORGIANA stares at BESS. What...? And then she realizes.
You summoned Grey.
Good night, G.  GEORGIANA makes her way across the hall.
GREY is sitting by the fire. The door opens. GEORGIANA enters. GREY stands up, yet keeps his distance.
Your Grace... Beat. They look at each other. GEORGIANA walks forward an kisses him. GREY kisses her back, but after a moment pull away. Beat.
(Firmly) I was ready to give you everything...how can I believe it won't happen again? GEORGIANA approaches again.

I give you my promise... GREY looks into her eyes, caught between his head and his heart. GEORGIANA starts to undress him, confidently, seductively until he is naked. GEORGIANA pushes GREY gently back onto the bed. Then she hitches up her skirts and straddles him, her dress enveloping the lower half of his body. Underneath, his hands reach inside to touch her. They begin making love. It's as if it's the first time fo both of them: real, intimate and convincing, an extraordinary release...
The window is open and wind blows gently in. Night birds call in the background. GEORGIANA and GREY lie in each other's arms. They kiss, long and tender. GREY pulls away
(Gently) You should return to your room.
No I should not.
A few days later. GEORGIANA, BESS, and the DUKE eat. GEORGIANA is nervous. She hesitates, then:
I'm going to Bath.
(looks up) But I can't get away for weeks.

(trying to seem natural) I shall go without you. (To Bess) Bess, you stay and keep our husband company, whilst I take the cure. The DUKE looks decidedly undecided. GEORGIANA looks to BE for help. She’s not sure it’s a good idea but acquiesces.
Yes, William, why not? If G goes now we can catch her up when you're free. GEORGIANA looks at BESS, thankful for the help. She tries to remain looking casual. The DUKE relents.
Well, if you must.

head_text.subj: EXT. RENTED BATH HOUSE. EARLY MORNING

text: Birdsong
It’s morning. GREY and GEORGIANA are in bed surrounded by newspapers and cartoons. They are looking at cartoons and laughing at them.
Which one is your favourite? This one?

(seriously at first) Well, in this one you are proud and strong, which is very good.... In this one you are fair and gentle... and in this one you seem to have only one eyebrow!  GEORGIANA laughs, trying to snatch the image out of his hands.
(giving him a playful nudge) Oh, you politicians know nothing of fashion. They laugh and continue:

But wait, wait... if you were to ask me which is my favourite... (leaning in and taking her face in his hands) it’s this one - my Duchess. The G no one else ever gets to see. They lock eyes, clearly in love, and kiss passionately.  120 121
POLITICAL PEOPLE are filing into a building for a meeting GREY and GEORGIANA are in an isolated alley, adjacent to the building, standing close, obviously in love.
Will you be long?
Until late I fear. It seems politics is divided into those who want to fix things and those that merely want to talk about fixing things. GEORGIANA smiles. GREY smiles.
I'll be waiting for you... She touches his arm gently and looks into his eyes. For a beat too long. Then GREY goes inside. ANGLE - THE END OF THE ALLEY: PEOPLE have spotted them.
GEORGIANA is in bed, naked and asleep. GREY is awake. He stares at her. Something is troubling him. She wakes, see his concern.
...What’s the matter? There is no reply.
Charles?
The matter is that in a few days I will have to leave. You will be back with your husband, and I won't be with you. GREY gets out of bed and walks to the window.

Perhaps it would be better if I were married too, then we could be a triangle or a quadrangle, or... whatever angle could contain you and me and-- I should ask Lady Bess; she seems to have surveyed the geometry and bent it to her favour. GEORGIANA gets out of bed and tries to comfort him.
Charles, we've had this time all for ourselves. Let’s not taint it with thoughts of anything else...Anyway, whatever will become of us when you're made Prime Minister? GREY laughs.
When you are, you'll be very far from me then.
(Very intense) Never. GEORGIANA embraces him. GREY holds her tight.
Contented and happy Grey walks into the political meeting rooms.  122 123

GEORGIANA is standing in her bedroom, a made bed behind her. A MAID puts the finishing touch to her hair and clothes. GEORGIANA walks out into the ante room, heading for the foyer. The double doors open in front of her... ...to reveal the DUKE and LADY SPENCER waiting for her. T are in travelling clothes. GEORGIANA gasps.
Thought we would surprise you. I think you once said there wasn't enough spontaneity in our marriage. Or words to that affect.
Mama, what are you doing here? LADY SPENCER sends her a severe look.
So. Have you seen many of our circle down here?
Some. The Cokes. And Haverford. And Lord Wicklow.
Bunch of politicos, too, aren't there? Meetings and such.
I believe.
Isn't... isn't Grey here? A beat as GEORGIANA's heart stops.
By which I mean Mr Charles Grey. Rumour has it that he is. GEORGIANA jumps to the heart of the issue.
I won't give him up.
Georgiana!
Everyone has a lover. Bess is the lover of my husband!
That situation was agreed upon.
Yes, I held myself in so little esteem that I acquiesced to make you happy!
If you had exercised some discretion, it may have been different.
Differ--?!
The only good fortune is that it hasn't yet made it to the newspapers.
My dear, Grey is unmarried. He has no rank and no wealth. He risks nothing with this affair. The hazard is all yours.
Grey loves me.
So does your husband. GEORGIANA stares at her mother in disbelief, then at the DUKE.
Yes. I love you!
In the way I understand love.
Georgiana, this has gone much too far. It is beneath our dignity. All London is talking...
Then let them talk! Grey makes me a fallen woman, well and good, now William may divorce me and Bess becomes Duchess of Devonshire!
That will never happen! LADY SPENCER stares harshly at GEORGIANA. Then she makes the door.
I think I will leave you to it. LADY SPENCER leaves the room. GEORGIANA looks apprehensiv at the DUKE.
What follows now? Are you going to tear off my clothes and force yourself upon me again?
Why on earth would I do that? GEORGIANA looks at him in surprise.

I know that you've not thought much of either my intellect or my Manners, but in fact I never do anything that serves no purpose. GEORGIANA is hurt, and looks at the DUKE in silence. He i composed in a way she has never seen before.
I know precisely what you two have together.
We love each other.

I do not doubt it. He is a dreamer like yourself. You both dream of another world that does not exist and never will. (Beat) As for reality, however, allow me to enlighten you: If you do not give him up at once, I will see to it that every home and cheque book in this country is closed to him. He will be welcome neither in the halls of government nor its back rooms of power. His dream of becoming prime minister, your mutual fantasy of a changed world, will be dead as ash. The DUKE pauses before delivering the final blow.
And you will never see your children again. GEORGIANA is open mouthed, stunned.
You are given to say "love is an act." Well, this is an act. GEORGIANA turns and runs out of the room.
GEORGIANA is close to the wall, trembling. LADY SPENCER enters and shuts the door behind her.
What do you imagine you will have if you stay with Grey?
Love. Passion.
For a time.
For ever.
There is no such thing.

Mama...all my life, it seems to me, I've been fighting my way upstream. With Charles, I find myself going down the stream, effortlessly and naturally. I never realized that it could be that easy. You can't ask me to battle nature, and my own heart. Not now.
Oh will you never grow up! And how will you live, even? Friends will shun you, family will abandon you. There won't be a house open to you in all of England.
(trying to convince herself) Grey will be Prime Minister.

Not with his whore, the Duchess of "D" on his arm and the Duke pulling every string to ruin him. He will never be Prime Minister. He'll pretend it doesn't matter, but it will. He'll put on a good face for a while, but he'll come to hate you for it. At this GEORGIANA's eyes fill with tears.
Most likely you’1l end up alone - a wife with no husband and a mother with no children. At best you'll become someone else’s mistress, living on charity, which can be taken away at any moment.
You can’t know all that!
Look at your friend Bess!
The DUKE waits by the front door. GEORGIANA exits the dressing room and walks toward him. Beat.
I must ask you to return to London.
Without you?
Yes. The DUKE takes out a PACKAGE OF LETTERS.

These are from the girls - I promised to deliver them. Hart neglected to write, but then he is not yet one. The DUKE puts the PACKAGE in her hand. GEORGIANA takes th but holds them down by her side, refusing to even acknowledge them.
I cannot give up Charles. I could not survive another day without him.
Then I must warn you. This will be the mistake of your life.
No, I made that many years ago. I trust you can let yourself out. GEORGIANA leaves. The DUKE sends her an icy stare, then t to the SERVANT at the door.

For God's sake, open the door, man! The servant quickly opens the door. The DUKE exits. LADY SPENCER follows from the ANTE ROOM. At the door she share one last sad look with GEORGIANA, then walks past.
GREY is pacing up and down. GEORGIANA remains standing. a
He will come down on us with ake everything in his power. aK
We must not be frightened into KKK submission. aK
We would be foolish not to be ake frightened. aK
No. We would be foolish to let ake future fears stand in our way. KKK
He will be without mercy. aK
Then so will we. aK GEORGIANA looks straight at him. aK
How Charles? aK
We'll fight... we
What do we have to fight with? KKK
Our ideals, our principles. And if we must we will make sacrifices.
And are you ready to do that? Everything you’ve worked for? Beat.
Yes, I am...whatever is necessary. If it means we will be together. GEORGIANA looks at him, trying to gauge in her own mind o she believes this. Before she is able to probe further...
Are you? Beat, as GEORGIANA considers the full consequences of thi
Yes. Beat. GREY smiles and kisses her.
Let us talk later. I shall be back soon. GEORGIANA looks at him as he leaves. GREY turns in the doorway and smiles. She smiles back at him but there is doubt creeping in behind it.

GEORGIANA enters the room, strong and confident. A SERVAN takes her cape and hat then leaves. GEORGIANA is alone. S is aware of the package of CHILDREN’S LETTERS on the side table where the DUKE left it. GEORGIANA turns away from it but after a moment turns bac She takes a deep breath and rips it open. There are LETTE in spidery children’s handwriting, colourful drawings. It hits her hard. She fingers trace over the drawings, the messages, the kisses at the bottom.... She is suddenly faced with the reality of the choice she about to make. It’s heart breaking but she knows she can’ be without her children.
GEORGIANA rushes into the hallway.

GEORGIANA runs into the room and hugs her children. Minutes later: we are behind the DUKE as he walks slowly down a corridor. We can hear children’s voices in the background. He reaches the end of the corridor and the scene is revealed: GEORGIANA sits in the middle of the room, surrounded by her children, playing a game together GEORGIANA hugs the girls. Closer. Tighter. In the background, GEORGIANA notices the DUKE surveying t scene. GEORGIANA gestures to the NANNY to come over.
Run along, girls. I shall join you in a moment. The GIRLS leave with the NANNY. The DUKE watches them go, then turns to GEORGIANA.
You must know that I am greatly pleased that we have come to an arrangement. It's not good for little ones to be without their mother for too long.
My life for theirs...
That's one way of putting it. Your mother called it "common decency before personal gratification", or some such thing... the exact words escape me...
How about ‘imprisoned in my own house’?
No, that's not how she put it. I would have remembered that. GEORGIANA sends him a hateful look and walks out.
GEORGIANA walks into the corridor. After a few moments sh sees BESS appear from the shadows.
(Whisper) How did Charles take it? GEORGIANA stops by her. She is businesslike.
I don’t know. I just left. If I had seen him again, I would have stayed.
No letter, either? GEORGIANA shakes her head.
I know it's cruel, Georgiana, but it’s for the best. GEORGIANA looks at BESS, then continues to walk off down the corridor.

head_text.subj: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. DINING ROOM. NIGHT

text: A VIOLINIST and HARPSICHORDIST play a beautiful, slow pie of music from the corner.
The music continues in the background as three silver plates covered by silver domes are carried by SERVANTS.

GEORGIANA, BESS and the DUKE are seated for dinner at the vast table. It’s tense, silent and extremely formal as th THREE SERVANTS bring in the plates. In unison they step forward to take away the domes, revealing elaborately prepared POUSSIN - it’s an unexpected comic moment. They begin to eat. No one says a word. Suddenly we hear DOORS CRASH OPEN from far outside the room. There is the distant sound of a man’s voice, raised and angry. GEORGIA knows immediately that it is GREY. So too does the DUKE w shoots her a vicious look. GEORGIANA rises,
Your Grace, Bess. Will you excuse me.

head_text.subj: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. ENTRANCE HALL. NIGHT

text: GEORGIANA enters to see GREY at the foot of the stairs, surrounded by FOOTMEN trying to stop him get further. GRE is wild. He yells at GEORGIANA, quite oblivious to the FOOTMEN.
Why haven't you responded to my letters?! GEORGIANA tries to maintain calm and walks toward him.
I have written a dozen times a day, and there is nothing from you! What has happened?! Do you love me no longer?! She looks at the FOOTMEN, headed by BURLEIGH, the butler.
Thank you, Burleigh. BURLEIGH bows, and though still remaining present, recede into the background with the FOOTMEN. GREY comes closer. GEORGIANA steels herself...
My personal feelings remain unaltered...
Then we must be together again. I want to marry you. I want you to bear my children ... and I don't care if they are boys or girls! ...But GEORGIANA is barely holding it together.
I wish it could be like that.
It can. It will. Sorrows come however we try to avoid them. We must stay our course and not give in.
(Firmly) No, Charles. GREY steps forward to take her arm but GEORGIANA backs away. BURLEIGH makes as if to intervene, but holds back.
You must leave and be with me, a free woman! Now, let us leave now! It is still possible. Let us at least take a chance.
I cannot risk my children. GREY stares at her with wide, angry, tortured eyes.

This is a sacrifice I am forced to make...but I have given you up for them only. And in so doing I have lost my heart and soul. GREY looks at her, sad and weak, nothing left to argue. GEORGIANA stands firm. She gestures to BURLEIGH.  139 140
Burleigh, will you please escort Mr. Grey to the door? BURLEIGH comes forward and stands next to GREY. GEORGIANA still looks at him. Her eyes glisten.
You promised me.
I know... GREY, choking with pain, stares one more beat, then turns and walks away. BURLEIGH and FOOTMEN follow, like bouncer

head_text.subj: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. DINING ROOM. NIGHT

text: GEORGIANA slowly sits again. She is distant, with no interest in the food in front of her. The DUKE looks up, chewing.
What’s the matter, don’t like the chicken? I find it really quite decent. The table is quiet. Not even BESS can muster a reply. GEORGIANA looks at him.
I’m with child.

INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. GEORGIANA’S BEDROOM - MORNING 140 Rain spits against the window. Wind blows in the trees outside. GEORGIANA is sitting in her bed, staring blankly before her. The DUKE and BESS enter.
(to Bess) Will you be so kind as to inform the Duchess of my decision? BESS looks deeply uncomfortable.
(appealingly) Georgiana - GEORGIANA does not respond, but keeps staring into the a BESS takes a deep breath.

It will be like this: you will be taken to the country where you will give birth to the child, and the child will subsequently be trusted to the care of Charles Grey's family. GEORGIANA makes no reply.
Are you listening to me? GEORGIANA slides silently into a reclining position.
I think she has heard you. Let's leave her.
Georgiana, please -—
I said: let's leave. This is not a discussion. She has been informed of my decision. BESS looks at GEORGIANA.
Have pity on her, William...
Pity be damned. She brought this upon herself, as well you know. Now come... The DUKE starts to go out. BESS’s voice stops him.
No. I will go with her.
You're not going anywhere...

(Turns, magnificently) I will go with G if G will have me, and there is nothing you can say or do to stop either of us. The DUKE is speechless. GEORGIANA looks up for the first time. The DUKE leaves. The women are left alone in silenc with each other. Their eyes meet.
On a windy, end of summer day, TWO PLAIN COACHES travel across the flat and largely featureless landscape.

location: SMALL HOUSE IN THE COUNTRYSIDE. DAY 143

text: The house is simple and remote, the only building for mil around. Chickens peck outside. It is far removed from the opulence GEORGIANA and BESS are used to. The two COACHES are parked outside. From the rear COACH, luggage is being unpacked and brought inside.
GEORGIANA enters this house with BESS and a SERVANT. It’s plain and unlived in. BESS follows GEORGIANA into what is to be her bedroom.
Thank you for coming.
I couldn't not be with you. GEORGIANA smiles.
I count it a triumph we have become friends again when fate has been so intent on keeping us rivals.
So do I. The Duke is for my boys only. You are for me. GEORGIANA puts her hands around her stomach.
Bess, how will I do this?
For Charlotte, for Harryo, for little G, for Hart... GEORGIANA nods her head.

head_text.subj: EXT. HOUSE IN THE COUNTRYSIDE. DAY

text: We hear the muted sounds of GEORGIANA screaming over shot of the house and the wildlife around it.

location: BEDROOM. HOUSE IN THE COUNTRYSIDE. MORNING 148

text: A baby is sleeping in its cot.  149 BESS is sitting in the other corner of the room. A FOOTMA appears at the door and nods to her. BESS looks apprehensive. She goes to GEORGIANA’s bedside.
(Gently) It’s time. GEORGIANA flinches - it’s the moment she’s been dreading. BESS comes closer and gestures toward the BABY.
Would it help if I...
(Looking up) No, Bess. I must do it. GEORGIANA snips a piece of hair from her sleeping baby an puts it in a distinctive silver locket.

It is a barren and featureless landscape with one straigh dirt track running through it. TWO DARK COACHES are alrea parked ahead. GEORGIANA’s COACH, containing GEORGIANA and BESS, pulls up fifty yards behind it. At the first of the DARK COACHES, a BUTLER stands to one side, a WET NURSE to the other. From the second steps a serious looking older man, GENERAL GREY. CHARLES GREY is nowhere to be seen. BESS looks on from the side of their COACH as GEORGIANA slowly takes the BABY up the track, holding it tight to h all the way.
(Flatly) Your Grace. I am General Grey.
Where is Charles?

Your husband thought it best if I took care of this. GEORGIANA takes a deep breath. She hadn’t expected this, and now she is being asked to hand her baby over to a stranger, and a seemingly cold one at that. It’s not clea that she will go through with it... GEORGIANA gently kisses the baby’s head, whispering to h smelling her hair, her skin, running her nose down her fa and breathing her in for one last time. BESS finds this impossible to watch and turns away.  150 With immense difficulty GEORGIANA finally goes to hand he baby over. GENERAL GREY does not take it. He nods sharply to his WET NURSE who steps forward to take the BABY, although for a moment GEORGIANA simply can’t let her go. GENERAL GREY immediately turns to go back to the COACH. GEORGIANA calls after him.
General Grey... GENERAL GREY stops and turns.

-.-her name is Eliza. GENERAL GREY looks at GEORGIANA giving nothing away. He turns and goes back into his COACH, followed by the BUTLE and the WET NURSE and GEORGIANA’S BABY GIRL into theirs. As the BABY GIRL is passed into the coach, GEORGIANA can hear her daughter begin to cry a little. GEORGIANA instinctively flinches, using all her strength to hold he back from running over to comfort her. The driver cracks the whip and GEORGIANA watches as the DARK COACHES ride off, leaving her alone with the barren landscape behind. She slowly sinks down onto the wet and muddy ground. BESS comes forward and holds her.

The cot is empty. Low winter sun cuts through the windows GEORGIANA sits alone in her bedroom, lost in thought and rolling a locket of Eliza’s hair back and forth between h fingers. It feels as if she has been sat there all night. BESS enters and comes close. It takes a moment for GEORGIANA to notice she’s even there. BESS produces two linen FLANNELS. GEORGIANA looks quizzically at them.
(Gently) For your milk. GEORGIANA looks down - there are two wet patches on her breasts. BESS kneels next to GEORGIANA and holds tight on GEORGIANA’s almost lifeless body.
The Duke has asked that we return as soon as possible. GEORGIANA nods but doesn’t move.

A primitive sprinkler is operated by a GARDENER spreading water across the manicured green grass making a loud and distinctive sound. Other GARDENERS are on their hands and knees cutting the grass with scissors. Time has elapsed, perhaps a month, and it’s spring now. Inside, there are a series of shots of the empty, still house.

GEORGIANA sits in a chair, distracted. She clutches the silver locket of Eliza's hair, the chain wrapped tight around her hand. A MAID appears at the door. GEORGIANA’s clutches the lock in her hand so it can’t be seen.
Your Grace, I have Charlotte to see you. GEORGIANA turns her head to the door. CHARLOTTE is standi with the MAID. She steps into the room.

We are all in the garden, Mama. Will you come and join us? GEORGIANA is unable to connect for a split second. CHARLOTTE remains looking at her. GEORGIANA comes to and about to say yes but sees the DUKE approaching from behin
In a moment. CHARLOTTE gives a small smile and leaves.
Hello, G.
Your Grace. The DUKE fidgets and, unusually for him, looks warmly at

I am not particularly adept at expressing myself when it comes to matters of a more personal nature, but I shall endeavour to try. [Beat] Over the years I have acted in ways that you have judged... harsh. Well I do not wish for you to undergo any further suffering. Indeed, I would like our life to return to a calm normality.
Thank you William. The DUKE looks relieved. He smiles.

Lady Melbourne has arranged a small gathering in honour of your recent return from holiday. Given some of the vague reports that have been circulating over this past year, I think it would be wise for us to go. A show of unity, so to speak. Beat.
Who will be there?
Everybody. GEORGIANA recognises what this must mean.

As you wish. The DUKE turns back to the window. We see what he sees: BESS is playing with all their children in the garden, th image distorted by the wavy glass of the window pane. It a mirrored moment from his opening scene where he watched the young people dancing, his thoughts then a mystery... The DUKE resumes his faraway look and says as if from nowhere,

How wonderful to be that free. GEORGIANA looks at him sympathetically, as if for the fir time she finally understands this trapped and complex man  153b The DUKE, a little exposed by his revealing statement, no and leaves, disappearing off into the long corridor. After a beat, GEORGIANA takes the DUKE’s position at the window and looks out at the children playing with BESS an smiles.

EXT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. GARDEN. DAY 153b BESS stands in the garden, watching the children. GEORGIA approaches from behind her. The two women look at each other, understanding the sentiment completely. They smile, then GEORGIANA leads th forward to the children. They turn to see her.
Who will catch me first? The children’s faces light up. GEORGIANA runs around the garden, chased by them and BESS until she finally allows herself to be caught.
A society gathering is in full swing. A FOOTMAN addresses the party in his booming voice.
The Duke and Duchess of Devonshire. And Lady Elizabeth Foster. Behind the front doors BESS whispers to GEORGIANA.
Are you ready for this?

Yes. The room goes quiet with a great sense of expectation... The doors swing open... GEORGIANA steps back into the limelight... She's looks stylish but in a mature, demure way. GEORGIANA walks through the crowd, taking in the scene around her. She nods hello to FOX and SHERIDAN, and there a warm, ad-hoc mix of bowing and ‘welcome home Your Grace She has been accepted back with respect and relief.

INT. LADY MELBOURNE’S HOUSE. ROOM - NIGHT 155B GEORGIANA enters another room full of people. Across it s sees CHARLES GREY. The DUKE and BESS are aware of him too but stand back to allow GEORGIANA to handle the situation It feels risky in this company but GEORGIANA walks throug the crowd toward him.
Mr Grey.

Your Grace... A subtle hush descends on the gathering as the GUESTS around them look over with bated breath, sensing the whif of scandal. The tension in the room is palpable. GEORGIANA’s is nervous and it is unclear whether she will give way to her emotions or manage to keep her composure. GREY too, is awkward but summons up the strength to act f the crowd.
I trust your tour was agreeable? GEORGIANA understands what he is doing and reciprocates.
Yes, thank you. We passed the summer in Switzerland and the winter in Nice.

Well, I speak for everybody when I say how glad I am that you have returned home safely. GEORGIANA smiles back. Her eyes tell a different story. T polite and seemingly innocent small talk continues...
And what news is there with you? GREY looks uncomfortable. Beat.
I am to be engaged to Lady Ponsonby. The announcement will follow shortly. GEORGIANA swallows hard. Beat.
Congratulations. Beat. GREY looks at her again.
And I have a niece... GEORGIANA looks up quickly.
+..-who is much loved. Beat as she takes a moment to digest this..
One day you should come and see her. In a little while. If you would like... Beat. They look at each other.

I would like that very much.  156 157 GEORGIANA curtsies with perfect etiquette and walks back into the party. GREY watches her go as she walks confidently off into the crowd to join the DUKE and BESS who are waiting for her.
It’s still and silent in the house.

The DUKE, BESS and GEORGIANA walk through a long corridor They stop at the point in the corridor where it splits in two directions: one toward the DUKE’s bedroom, the other toward GEORGIANA and BESS’s.
Good night, G.
Good night, William. The DUKE turns to BESS, expecting her to follow him. BESS looks to GEORGIANA, who looks back intensely. BESS gets t message and turns back to the DUKE.
Good night, William. The DUKE is surprised, but doesn’t want to upset the newfound harmony.

Oh yes, well...Good night Bess. The DUKE walks off to his bedroom alone. GEORGIANA and BE walk together, two massive dresses side by side down the middle of the wide corridors and rooms, rustling in the silence. They look at each other and smile supportively, then reach out to hold hands.
(FORMERLY PART OF SC. 157) INT. GEORGIANA’S BEDROOM. 160

GEORGIANA and BESS settle outside GEORGIANA’s bedroom. GEORGIANA looks at BESS. BESS smiles back. They embrace a BESS walks off. In a mirror of scene 4AB GEORGIANA walks from camera int the room, then turns around for us to see her strong, determined face. GEORGIANA nods to two servants who step forward, take the handles and pull the double doors close GEORGIANA’s face finally disappearing behind the crack in the middle with a bang. Cut to black. After a moment the following words appear: Georgiana, the Duke and Bess lived openly together for th next ten years until Georgiana died Fade out / fade in: Georgiana ensured in her will that Bess could marry the Duke and become the next Duchess of Devonshire Fade out / fade in Grey became Britain’s 32nd Prime Minister Fade to black, then fade up to: A PORTRAIT OF ELIZA - her face a mix between GEORGIANA an GREY. On this is superimposed: In late childhood Eliza found out the true identity of he mother. The source of the informant remains unknown. The picture pans down to a miniature around ELIZA’s neck it is of GEORGIANA as she started in the film: an open, optimistic seventeen year old girl smiling out to camera. End titles.
